newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy bourse watchdog demands answers by Olivetti.
newsitem.headline: Italy bourse watchdog demands answers by Olivetti.

text.p: The Italian bourse watchdog, Consob, has demanded that ailing information technology group Olivetti supply answers on Tuesday to 16 points it wants clarified regarding the group's financial performance.

It said in a statement issued late on Monday that, "given the market's urgent requirements to have further information...(and) considering the delay of a meeting with analysts scheduled for today, as well as the development of the situation on the market," it was publishing the list of questions put to Olivetti at a meeting on September 12.
Olivetti shares were suspended on Monday after falling to a record low of 515 lire and failed repeatedly to restart trading.
Following are Consob's 16 requests. It was not immediately clear what time it had set as a deadline for replies.
1. Information regarding forecast development of the group, including possible disposals or strategic alliances
2. Explanation for valuation of some Olivetti subsidiaries at June 30
3. Run-down of major stock in warehouse, plus details
4. Full details of 200 billion lire provisions for restructuring
5. Clarification of valuation used for credits to Russian government bodies
6. Details of credits to public administration
7. Details of contractual conditions of sale of packet of Acorn shares to a financial institution
8. Details of future profitability of capitalised software
9. Clarification of mandate given to consultants Bain and Cuneo and details of relationship with group
10. Details of net financial position at August 31, 1996
11. Explanation of payments to suppliers between January 1 and June 30, 1996
12. Reasons behind sharp rise at June 30, 1996, of securitisation credits
13. Details of financial conditions of credit sales
14. Details of ongoing securitisation programme
15. Details of total orders at June 30, 1996
16. Full details of debt
